word: der Lügst, die There seems to be a typo in the last example. assuming it is meant to be "der lügner" (the liar), the plural form would be "lügner".
definition: The word "lügst" refers to the act of intentionally providing false information or deceiving someone. It is commonly used to describe the action of telling lies or engaging in dishonesty.

examples.english: He claims that you are lying.
Why are you lying to me?

examples.german: Sie lügt immer, um sich herauszureden.
examples.english: She always lies to get out of trouble.

examples.german: Lügst du mich an, um mich zu verletzen?
examples.english: Are you lying to hurt me?
